newsitem.title: USA: U.S MUNICIPAL FOCUS - looking for modest jobs data.
newsitem.headline: U.S MUNICIPAL FOCUS - looking for modest jobs data.

text.p: U.S. municipal bonds late Thursday were quoted from unchanged to off about one-quarter of a point as traders adjusted positions ahead of the payrolls data, which some hope will prove surprisingly mild.
Noting some estimates that predict the economy only added 175,000 jobs, a trader said "There is a school of thought that expects it be a little lower."
A Reuters consensus survey of economists showed they look for a slightly smaller gain of around 166,000 jobs.
But if the payrolls data, which are due out on Friday at 0830 EDT, show that the economy grew at a faster clip than such forecasts, the market could turn down sharply.

"It's going to be a big disappointment if this thing comes in with a two-handle," the trader said, referring to the possibility that the data might show the number of jobs climbed by more than 200,000.
In the previous month, August, payrolls increased by 250,000.
And some traders said there seemed to be more than one interested buyer. "There's definitely more than one that's going to be involved in this," a trader said.
A gauge of the secondary market's size, Standard & Poor's Blue List, firmed to more than $1.2 billion from levels seen earlier this week.

December municipal bond futures traded on the Chicago Board of Trade rose three ticks to 115-8/32, while December Treasury bond futures were unchanged at 110-10/32. As a result, the MOB spread between the two futures contracts strengthened a few ticks to plus 158.
The Reuters 10-year municipal general obligation bond index fell four basis points from last week to 5.06 percent from 5.10 percent.

In the seconary market, actively quoted issues included North Central Texas Health Facilities Development Revenues of June 2021, which carry a 5-1/2 percent coupon. The bids were at 5.82 percent NET, unchanged.
And Cook County Illinois Capital Improvement Original Issue Discount of November 2022, which pay a 5-7/8 percent coupon, were bid at 99-3/4, also unchanged.
